H0.text: Using more than one caterpillar could improve the student's experiment, which investigated the effect of temperature on the distance a caterpillar travels in one minute at four different times of day.

H1.text: Performing the investigation on a wet surface could improve the studentâ€™s experiment, which examines the effect of temperature on the distance a caterpillar travels in one minute, conducted at four different times of day using a single caterpillar.

H2.text: Using earthworms instead of caterpillars could improve the experiment that investigates how temperature affects the distance a caterpillar travels in one minute, which currently relies on a single caterpillar tested at four different times of day.

H3.text: Performing the investigation at the same time on four days is how the experiment investigating the effect of temperature on the distance a caterpillar travels in one minute could be improved, since the student had previously used one caterpillar at four different times of day.

A4.text: What is the sample size? How many units must be collected for the experiment to be generalisable and have enough power?
